jrobots.simulation.simulationObjects.collision

Class CollisionBodyWall

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrobots.simulation.simulationObjects.collision.Collision
      • jrobots.simulation.simulationObjects.collision.CollisionBodyWall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Collision>

    public class CollisionBodyWall
extends Collision
    This type resembles the collision with a solid wall.

    Please note that current physics allow to overcome even a wall through constant pressing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CollisionBodyWall

        public CollisionBodyWall(MotionTargetPanzer colliderTgt,
                         Angle wallNormal,
                         double time)
        Parameters:
        colliderTgt - - the Body to collide
        wallNormal - - global axes; caller must precalculate that; must point to the colliderTgt to be effective (will only apply a braking force)
        time - - may be of relevance for collision priority; supply a time near the end of the collision frame as default.

    • Method Detail

      • discoverCollision

        public static CollisionBodyWall discoverCollision(MotionTargetPanzer colliderTgt,
                                                  Angle wallNormal,
                                                  double time)
        However reason the wall has to exist, this call creates a collision with it unconditionally. So call only if you have already checked.
        Parameters:
        colliderTgt - - the Body to collide
        wallNormal - - global axes; caller must precalculate that; must point to the colliderTgt to be effective (will only apply a braking force)
        time - - may be of relevance for collision priority; supply a time near the end of the collision frame as default.

        public void react(SimulationState state,
                  java.util.List<MotionTargetPanzer> panzerTargets,
                  SimulationMode simulationMode)
        Description copied from class: Collision
        Performs collision effects. Objects may be manipulated and removed from the state's objects lists.

        Parameters:
        state - SimulationState to manipulate
        panzerTargets - If forces are exerted, the motion targets must be updated
